result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan D Novak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 1 day sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 & 3.

Court will allow for trans to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 & 3.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Psychological evaluation and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.

Defendant not to reside in the family residence.
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.
No violent contact with victims/family members listed in the Criminal Complaint.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jonathan D Novak in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  

State moves to amend the Felonies to 3 Misdemeanors.
Amended Information Filed.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to all 3 of the amended charges.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of all 3 of the amended charges.
Defendant's mother presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.




Court orders the following:
Count 1:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
1 Day Credit.
Concurrent to:  Counts 2 & 3
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Concurrent to:  Counts 2 & 3
Court will allow for transfer to:  Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Defendant not to reside in the family residence.
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
Psychological evaluation and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No violent contact with:  victims/family members listed in the criminal complaint
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation (to be paid within the first year of probation).

CONDITION TIME:
30 Days in the Waukesha county Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at the agents discretion.





Count 2:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
1 Day Credit.
Concurrent to:  Counts 1 & 3
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 2 Years
Concurrent to:  Counts 1 & 3
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as Count 1.

Costs:  $243
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation (to be paid within the first year of probation).



Count 3:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
1 Day Credit.
Concurrent to:  Counts 1 & 3
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Concurrent to:  Counts 1 & 2
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation (to be paid within the first year of probation).
